Package com.motorolasolutions.mpact.mpactclient

MPact Locationing

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MPactClientConsumer
    An interface for an Android Activity or Service that wants to interact with the MPact Server.
    MPactClientNotifier
    Optional callback methods for the MPact Client.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MPactClient
    A class used to set up interaction with the MPact Server from an Activity or Service.
    MPactSDKVersion  
    MPactServerInfo
    Holds the network information relevant to the MPact server
    MPactTag
    Holds the properties that describe the state of an MPact Tag

    Enum Description
    MPactBeaconType
    Format of the beacon used by the locationing tag

Package com.motorolasolutions.mpact.mpactclient Description

MPact Locationing

MPact represents a new real-time micro-locationing system. The MPact locationing solution leverages Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) tags to allow a Bluetooth 4.0 device to be precisely located. When the phone/tablet supporting BLE gets close to a tag, it recognizes a wireless beacon from the tag using its Bluetooth radio. Because the radio is low energy, and its signal does not propagate far, the client can be precisely located by the beacons it recognizes.

MPact Architecture

The MPact architecture consists of the following components:
  • MPact Tags: Hardware tags installed at a customer site that generate Bluetooth beacons
  • MPact Server: Backend software that aggregates tag locationing data and handles analytics and configuration
  • MPact Toolbox: Mobile application that manages tag installation and maintenance
  • MPact Client API: Mobile library that integrates into partner applications and sends locationing information to the MPact Server

About MPact Client API

MPact Client is an API which allows an application to scan for MPact BlueTooth Low Energy tags and send the information about the closest tag to the MPact server. The MPact Client API supports java interface and should be integrated into a partner application.

Adding MPact Client API to Your Project

MPact Client Library

The MPact Client API is distributed as java jar module. Add the file MPactClient.jar to the libs directory in your project directory in order to get access to the objects that make up the MPact Client API.

Project Manifest

The MPact Client library makes use of the internet and BlueTooth LE. Your application will need to add the following permissions to your project manifest.
  • android.permission.INTERNET
  • android.permission.BLUETOOTH
  • android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN
      

          
          <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
          <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH"/>
          <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN"/>
The MPact Client library starts up a local service to process BlueTooth LE beacons. Your application will need to add the MPactService to your project manifest. 
      

          
          <application
              <service android:enabled="true"
                  android:exported="false"
                  android:isolatedProcess="false"
                  android:label="MPact"
                  android:name="com.motorolasolutions.mpact.mpactclient.MPactService">
              </service>
          </application>

Session Cookies

The MPact Client library makes use of session cookies, but, does not manage its own cookies. Your application will need to implement a Cookie Manager in order for the updates to the MPact Server to succeed.

Sample Code

In the example below, an Activity implements the MPactClientConsumer interface, binds to the MPactService through the MPactClient, then when it gets the callback saying the service is ready, it starts looking for MPact tags. 

  public class MPactActivity extends Activity implements MPactClientConsumer {
      protected static final String TAG = "MPactActivity";
      private static CookieManager cookieManager;
      private MPactClient mpactClient = MPactClient.getInstanceForApplication(this);
      @Override
      protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
          super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
          setContentView(R.layout.activity_ranging);
          mpactClient.bind(this);
          // Setup cookies
          cookieManager = new CookieManager();
          CookieHandler.setDefault(cookieManager);
      }
       @Override
      protected void onDestroy() {
          super.onDestroy();
          mpactClient.unBind(this);
      }
       @Override
      public void onMPactClientServiceConnect() {
          mpactClient.setNotifier(new MPactClientNotifier() {
              @Override
              public void didDetermineClosestTag(MPactTag mpactTag) {
                  Log.i(TAG, "Tag " + mpactTag.getTagID() + " is near.");
              }
              @Override
              public void didDetermineState(int state) {
                  if(state == MPactClientNotifier.INSIDE) {
                      Log.i(TAG, "Entered an area with tags.");
                  } else {
                      Log.i(TAG, "There are no tags nearby.");
                  }
              }
          });

          try {
              mpactClient.Start();
          } catch (RemoteException e) {    }
      }
  }
